creditline: Bequest of John R. Van Derlip in memory of Ethel Morrison Van Derlip
description: Dalmatic of tan velvet with pomegranate pattern on tan satin ground. Edged with gold gimp and decorated with bands of linen embroidered with Lucca-type designs in red, green and white and the alternation names IHESUS and MARIA in blue. Mrs. Reed Says Bands of Cologne - brocade are XIV c., Velvet probably XV c. Pica made up.
medium: Voided velvet with woven orphrey; silk, linen, and metallic thread
text: The orphrey was woven in Germany, probably in Cologne, in the 15th century.
title: Dalmatic
